parent_disease: Brain and central nervous system neoplasm
reasoning: Temporal lobe neoplasms represent a subset of intracranial tumors. Global brain tumor incidence approximately 10 per 100k; temporal lobe accounts for ~20-25% of intracranial tumors. Estimated temporal lobe neoplasm incidence ~2-3 per 100k. Significant variation by tumor type (glioblastoma vs lower-grade gliomas vs metastatic disease).
